brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to compare the efficacy of 400 µg  vaginal misoprostol  per 3
      hours to 400 µg buccal misoprostol per 3 hours in second trimester termination of viable
      pregnancy

clinical_study.brief_title: Misoprostol for Second Trimester Termination of Pregnancy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  gestational age between 12-24 weeks

          -  live fetus

          -  singleton pregnancy

          -  Bishop score <5

          -  no uterine contraction

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  prostaglandin allergy

          -  a scar in uterus

          -  uterine abnormality

          -  premature rupture of membranes

intervention.description: 400 µg vaginal misoprostol per 3 hours up to 6 doses. The treatment will be withold if the patient has strong uterine contractions. If abortion had not occured in 24 hour after the start of the study a second course of 400 µg vaginal misoprostol per 3 hours up to 6 doses  will be administered. If abortion  had not occured in 48 hour after the start of the study  it will be considered treatment failure and patient will be offered another induction/delivery method or to continue protocol.

400 µg buccal misoprostol per 3 hours up to 6 doses. The treatment will be withold if the patient has strong uterine contractions. If abortion had not occured in 24 hour after the start of the study a second course of 400 µg buccal misoprostol per 3 hours up to 6 doses  will be administered. If abortion  had not occured in 48 hour after the start of the study  it will be considered treatment failure and patient will be offered another induction/delivery method or to continue protocol.

clinical_study.official_title: A Comparison Between Vaginal Misoprostol vs. Buccal Misoprostol For Second Trimester Termination of Pregnancy

other_outcome.measure: difference in hematocrit measured at entry of the study  and after delivery/abortion
other_outcome.time_frame: at recruitment and 24 hour after abortion

other_outcome.description: includes, but not limited blood, transfusions, laparatomy, nausea, vomiting, fever, genital tract injury

primary_outcome.description: Time elapsed between administration of the first misoprostol dose until expulsion of the fetus

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: the patients who did not delivered within 48 hours will considered as failed induction and will be offered another method of induction/delivery or to continue same protocol.
Perceived pain will be measured by Face Pain Scale-Revised
secondary_outcome.measure: Perceived pain before induction and after abortion completed
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 1 hour after randomisation and after 12 hour after complete abortion/placenta removed
12 hour after fetus and placenta removed

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
